intro: Echites subspicatus, commonly known as the spiny echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Echites subspicatus is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of local ecosystems.
